explanation: a short period of illness or involvement in an activity
sentence: He suffered from periodic bouts of insanity.
sentence_gap: He suffered from periodic _____ of insanity.

explanation: to make continuous loud noises by hitting hard objects against each other, or to cause objects to do this
sentence: Don’t clatter the pots and pans – you’ll wake the baby up.
sentence_gap: Don’t _______ the pots and pans – you’ll wake the baby up.

explanation: having a good understanding of a particular subject and the ability to make good judgments about it
sentence: Simon has a clear-sighted vision of the company's future.
sentence_gap: Simon has a _____________ vision of the company's future.

explanation: the action of giving someone a weak form of a disease as protection against it, or something such as an injection that is given in this way
literary; consisting of many things or parts
sentence: The performers displayed their multitudinous talents.

explanation: formal; a trick or a dishonest way of achieving something
sentence: It was clear that they must have obtained the information by subterfuge.
sentence_gap: It was clear that they must have obtained the information by __________.

explanation: that does not produce the result you want; (disapproving) too proud of your own appearance, abilities, or achievements
sentence: He was very vain about his hair and his clothes.
sentence_gap: He was very ____ about his hair and his clothes.

explanation: in a strong and emotional way
sentence: The president has vehemently denied having an extra-marital affair.
sentence_gap: The president has __________ denied having an extra-marital affair.

explanation: a piece of land on which vines are grown
sentence: They are also fond of grapes and other fruits, and are thus the pests of the vineyard as well as the poultryyard.
sentence_gap: They are also fond of grapes and other fruits, and are thus the pests of the ________ as well as the poultryyard.

explanation: to open the mouth wide and take a lot of air into the lungs and slowly send it out, usually when tired or bored
sentence: I can't stop yawning - I must be tired.
sentence_gap: I can't stop _______ - I must be tired.
